results.title: The Story of Long John
results.creator_credit: Campbell Harper Films and Alan Harper
results.brief_description: A film about the establishment of a new Long John Scotch Whisky at Tormore in the Scottish Highlands - the first completely-built distillery in the highlands in the 20th century. Workers’ homes and the distillery were designed to fit in with the landscape. Tormore was chosen because of its water quality. The process of distilling and blending is also featured.

results.title: The Story of locomotive haulage in the present age
results.creator_credit: Big Six Film Unit and Edward Cook
results.brief_description: The story of the Huwood Hudswell diesel mine locomotive. Shows various features, its uses of special man-riding cars for speedy transport of miners to coal face; effect of new transport system; speedier output, larger loads and increased coal production.

results.title: The Story of little Tattian
results.creator_credit: Sakura Motion Pictures and Michiharu Aoyama
results.brief_description: The escapades of a five-year-old in a Japanese family. Based on a story by a well-known Japanese juvenile writer and financed by a women’s group interested in producing good films for children. Little Tattian plays pranks on his brother and sister, presents his grandmother with his box of `treasures’ (bees’ wings, buttons and the likes), leaves his brother at the market and hides at home while others frantically search for him, and indulges in elaborate fantasies of bogeymen. Cast: Takahide Funazu, Yoshonori Tanaka, Yukiko Ibuki, Kumeke Urabe, Tony Tani, Setsuko Sinobu.

results.title: The Story of Henry Handel Richardson
results.brief_description: This animated short was highly commended in the “Create a Stamp Story” section of the Screen It! competition. Henry Handel Richardson was the pseudonym of Ethel Florence Lyndsey Richardson; this stamp story is about her achievements in music and literature. An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Story of H.M.S. Shannon (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A lively touch to any program, this song story describes an incident in the War of 1812. Colourful drawings give a satirical twist to the engagement between a British ship, the H.M.S. Shannon, and an American ship, the U.S.S. Chesapeake. Sung to guitar accompaniment by Canadian folksinger Tom Kines.

results.title: The Story of fine china
results.brief_description: The history of pottery, china and earthenware, leading up to the achievements of Josiah Spode and showing present-day manufacturing methods which have changed very little in 150 years.

results.title: The Story of Eric
results.brief_description: Follows the story of Wendy Johnston from the eighth month of her pregnancy to the birth of her first child, a son, Eric. Wendy and her husband Richard are seen attending classes in the Lamaze method of prepared childbirth, and practising the breathing exercises at home. As a result, wendy is in complete control of her body during labour and is fully aware of the experience.

results.title: The Story of English. Parts 1-4
results.brief_description: Prog 1 - An English speaking world; Prog 2 - The Mother Tongue Prog 3 - A Muse of Fire; Prog 4 - The Guide Scots Tongue. A Nine Part series that tells the story of English as a spoken language: how it started and survived, spread and developed. “The Story of English” spans more than 1,000 years of world history and visits locations on five continents. It presents a picture of the English speaking world and English speaking peoples of many nationalities and backgrounds.

results.title: The Story of English furniture. Part 1
results.creator_credit: BBC, Paul Smith and Robin Drake
results.brief_description: Arthur Negus and Hugh Scully tell the fascinating story of English furniture from its very beginnings to the 18th century. They demonstrate the all-important points of design and detail which make it easier to date furniture and to tell the difference between the original and the fake or copy. Part one of this two part program consists of 4 segments: Medieval and Elizabethan; Jacobean and Restoration; William and Mary; Queen Anne and Early Georgian.

results.title: The Story of diplomacy
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Ian Dunlop
results.brief_description: Traces the history of diplomacy from the days of early Greek and Egyptian civilization. The establishment of resident ambassadors abroad, the introduction of congresses and the “balance of power”, the revolt against secrecy after World War I, resulting in the League of Nations and later the United Nations. Emphasises the continuing importance of individual negotiations. Narrated by Alastair Duncan.
